name: jhunt
text: Man, seeing Ray being treated like a cat is hell of weird.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Man, you just don't pick up a cat ever. They don't like it at all.

name: spectre
text: Unless you are a teenage girl. They can get away with it. My stepdaughters can.

name: songbirdspectre
text: yep. i am proof.

name: straw
text: You're spectre's setpdaughter?

name: tasteful
text: it is plausible based on the names

name: fosters
text: My old cat was mean as hell all her life, and the only person she EVER let pick her up without shredding (aside from me on very rare occasions) was this loud little 5 or 6 year old girl who lived next door to us. The first time I saw her pick the cat up before I could stop her it felt like one of those dreams where you're running away from something in slow motion. I was thinking "oh Jesus this kid is dead and I'm going to have to explain to her parents why my cat tore her face off NOOOOOO" but the cat just quietly put up with it.

name: canusdivinus
text: Cats know the difference between kids and adults. They'll take hella abuse from kids, because they understand that kids don't know better.

name: tekende
text: Exactly. Dogs are usually the same way, provided they haven't had a horrible abusive owner or something.

name: tfaironpirate
text: This sounds like pet-lovery, but is actually mostly accepted scientific fact.

name: dusty
text: I think many pets understand the ass-whooping that might come from harming a kid. My grandpa had this big German Sheppard that would growl and snap at anyone but him, but if a 4 year old grandchild sat on it's back, grabbed it's ears like the reins of a horse and started bouncing, it just sat there with the uncomfortable tolerance of a man getting a prostate exam.

name: glorify
text: What a fantastic metaphor that is.

name: dybrar
text: The German Shepherd's uncomfortableness is so accurately conveyed.

name: closefriend
text: I pick up my 25 lb. cat every day. I even held him on his back every day for the first two years of his life. It teaches him who is in charge.

name: xiaomimi
text: Dang!  My boyfriend does the same thing with our cat, and for the same reason.  I did not think that was a habit that extended beyond his idiosyncrasies.

name: blueloggy
text:
Dang! My boyfriend does the same thing with ME, and for the same reason!

He is a terrible boyfriend.

name: snowman
text: That seems mean, kind of.

name: gouldgonewild
text: This is what I plan on doing to my children.

name: tekende
text: Well, yes, children under two like being picked up.

name: slalvation
text: My cats love it, if you're family.

name: hrm
text: when anybody picks up my mom's cat, he basically becomes one with you.

name: idsyen
text: It seems clear that different cats have different personalities. For instance, some come from circumstances and have depression, whereas some have alcoholism and think it's rad.

name: meringue
text:
It just depends how they are raised. Cats get a lot of stereotypes from things that simply spur up as a result of very passively caring for them.

My cat is a real people... cat. Always wants attention and to be held.

name: shmuckeles
text: don't pick one up like THAT, that's for sure

name: jstegall
text: Man, I just wouldn't pick up a thong wearin' cat at all. Besides, with those glasses and the gold chain, Raymo Smookles looks like he's in the Yakuza.

name: tom-ba
text: You should check to see if he's missing a claw .

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zefiel, SoManyWhales, cognitonaut, profbobo, stoned_lightning)

name: howard
text: The tiniest martini glass that ever there was.

name: hellofyellin
text: "Cooked up real good" is one of my favorite Achewood-isms to use basically anytime, such as making a simple pasta.

name: hellofditties
text: Except that the quote is "baked."

name: hellofyellin
text: I am enthusiastic about this funny-strip.

name: hellofditties
text: I retract my statement.

name: hellofyellin
text: Thank you.  Martini?

name: hellofditties
text: I was kinda hoping you'd mention how awesome our screen names are.

name: hellofyellin
text: We are so awesome.  So you don't want a martini?  I made one just for you.

name: hellofditties
text: Is it chilled up real good?

name: hellofyellin
text: Chilled and stirred.  Ice in the glass, hell of class.

name: fineoakstructure
text: she is 18 / you are arrested.

name: hellofyellin
text:
Ah. So I should check the agey thing up there on the icon, huh?

YOU want one?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
HELL YES

BOUT TIME

name: hellofditties
text: WAIT!  If I drink it over here it's okay, right?  Fax it to me.

name: evilrobot
text: I liked this series of strips because it shows Chris has a genuine affection for his characters, as do we all

name: saulbellow
text: Rarely did Charles Schultz pick up a protesting Snoopy.

name: tombsgrave
text: ... baked hot dogs?

name: andrew_
text: that's what I was thinking!

name: spectre
text: Ray's recipe in RECIPES FOR A LADY OR A MAN specifies that they must be cooked in a small amount of water on the stovetop. They MUST be!

name: dropkickpikachu
text:
Simmer the frankfurter.
It muft simmer!

name: choosebro
text: Your Avatar gives a little bit extra to each message.

name: fuckalgebra
text: They're actually really good if you do it right. They come out a lot like grilled ones. It was this strip inspired me to try it.

name: spectre
text: Alt text: "A good birthday present is to order the book"

name: thisdoggisproice
text: It looks like Chris is trying to throttle Ray's entire body, yet still making extra sure not to touch the thong.

name: hpk
text:
It almost looks like he's trying to wring juice from Ray, like a towel

...dipped in juice I guess.

name: gussiejives
text: I'd be nervous about picking up a thong-wearing, bipedal cat that can talk.  Especially when he's clearly been drinking.

name: aperson
text: Look at Onstads bit stupid hands. Strong chin though.

name: snowman
text: They look like big, strong hands, don't they?

name: landowmpg
text: Is this a Never Ending Story reference? If so: nice.

name: aperson
text: Assetbar: sorry I criticised Chris Onstad's hands and did a typo. Lames accepted.

name: milksteak
text: Those are the hands magic come from.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: That is not a hands

name: shoinan
text: It is not cool to pick up a player, even if it is your birthday.

name: dasilodavi
text: I know a cat who does this exact same thing.

name: tekende
text: It talks about hot dogs?

name: dasilodavi
text: No, it hangs out all chill like but bitches incessantly when you try to pick it up.

name: faits
text: oh you mean every cat ever

name: undyingsong
text: Except for those cats which like to sit innocently in your lap, and then attempt to eat your arm. :(

name: rowboat
text: This is where Lie Bot got his shoes. Lie Bot wears Onstad's shoes. Michael J. Fox had nothing to do with it. That robot has deceived me for the last time. This time I mean it.

name: nucleargeranium
text: hell yes, oven hotdogs are the bomb! Unlike oven FRIES, which just get hella soggy and nasty. Especially Pat's oven fries.

name: steerpike66
text: I don't like seeing our guys in proportion. I hate proportion. Everything should be hella skewed.

name: dovey
text: I think my favourite Achewoods all end with Onstad picking a cat up.

name: jonmw
text:
Onstad is not using proper cat-lifting technique. Here is a diagram demonstrating the correct method:
[IMGS OFF]

name: babeeazz
text: ray is a very tiny cat.  when my cats stand up on their hind legs they reach quite a bit over my knee.  ray is a midgie-kittie.

name: cracklewater
text: Onstad may be a GIANT MAN.

name: origotoshi
text: I think you may just be short... If a cat stood up next to me, it would probably be around knee-height, and I'm 6 feet~.

name: carlyle
text: A person in Achewood? This hasn't happened until the Toilet Party!
